members.name: Animator
members.description: Play animation via start/stop frame labels

members.name: LOOP_LABEL
members.brief: Suffix added to label for a loop.

members.name: STOP_LABEL
members.brief: Suffix added to label for a stop.

members.name: fromTo
members.description: Play a MovieClip from a start to end frame.

returns.description: Timeline object for stopping or getting progress.

members.name: play
members.description: Play the entire duration of the MovieClip.

returns.description: Timeline object for stopping or getting progress.

members.name: play
members.description: Play an animation by frame labels. For instance, play animation sequence from 'idle' to 'idle_stop' or 'idle_loop'. If no ...

params.description: The frame label event to call, if no event is provided will use the entire length of the MovieClip.

returns.description: Timeline object for stopping or getting progress.

members.name: stop
members.description: Stop the animation by instance.

members.name: to
members.description: Play an animation from the current frame to an end frame or label.

returns.description: Timeline object for stopping or getting progress.

members.name: _internalStop
members.description: Stop the animation

members.name: _pool
members.description: The pool of timelines to use

members.name: callback
members.description: Callback called when completed (non-looping animation).

members.name: end
members.description: Frame number of the ending frame.

members.name: instance
members.description: Instance of clip to play.

members.name: loop
members.description: true if the timeline is suppose to loop.

members.name: progress
members.brief: The progress from 0 to 1 of the playback.

members.name: start
members.description: Frame number of the starting farme.

members.name: destroy
members.description: Don't use after this

members.name: init
members.description: The pool of timelines to use

members.name: update
members.description: Is the animation complete

members.name: DEFAULT_FRAMERATE
members.brief: The default framerate if none is specified or there's not parent clip with a framerate.

members.name: INDEPENDENT
members.description: The MovieClip will advance independently of its parent, even if its parent is paused. This is the default mode.

members.name: SINGLE_FRAME
members.brief: The MovieClip will only display a single frame (as determined by the startPosition property).

members.name: SYNCHED
members.description: The MovieClip will be advanced only when its parent advances and will be synched to the position of the parent MovieClip.

members.name: actionsEnabled
members.brief: If true, actions in this MovieClip's tweens will be run when the playhead advances.

members.name: autoReset
members.description: If true, the MovieClip will automatically be reset to its first frame whenever the timeline adds it back onto the display ...

members.name: currentFrame
members.description: The current frame of the movieclip.

members.name: currentLabel
members.brief: Returns the name of the label on or immediately before the current frame.

members.name: elapsedTime
members.brief: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds.

members.name: framerate
members.description: By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip will cause it to advan...

members.name: isMovieClip
members.description: Fast way of checking if a movie clip is actually a movie clip. Prevents circular references and is faster than instanceof....

members.name: labels
members.brief: Returns an array of objects with label and position (aka frame) properties, sorted by position.

members.name: labelsMap
members.brief: Returns a dictionary of labels where key is the label and value is the frame.

members.name: loop
members.brief: Indicates whether this MovieClip should loop when it reaches the end of its timeline.

members.name: mode
members.description: Controls how this MovieClip advances its time. Must be one of 0 (INDEPENDENT), 1 (SINGLE_FRAME), or 2 (SYNCHED). See each ...

members.name: parentFramerate
members.brief: Get the close parent with a valid framerate. If no parent, returns the default framerate.

members.name: paused
members.brief: If true, the MovieClip's position will not advance when ticked.

members.name: selfAdvance
members.brief: If true, this movieclip will animate automatically whenever it is on the stage.

members.name: startPosition
members.brief: Specifies what the first frame to play in this movieclip, or the only frame to display if mode is SINGLE_FRAME.

members.name: totalFrames
members.brief: Get the total number of frames (duration) of this MovieClip

members.name: _actions
members.brief: Array of frame scripts, indexed by frame.

members.name: _framerate
members.description: By default MovieClip instances advance one frame per tick. Specifying a framerate for the MovieClip will cause it to advan...

members.name: _timelines
members.description: Standard tween timelines for all objects. Each element in the _timelines array is a Timeline object - an array of tweens f...

members.name: _beforeUpdate
members.description: Optional callback fired before timeline is updated. Can be used to clamp or update the currentFrame.

members.name: _duration
members.brief: The total time in seconds for the animation. This is changed when setting the framerate.

members.name: _prevPos
members.brief: Previous position that this movieclip was stopped on.

members.name: _synchOffset
members.brief: Offset from parent frame for a synched movieclip.

members.name: _t
members.description: Note - changed from default: When the MovieClip is framerate independent, this is the time elapsed from frame 0 in seconds...

members.name: _timedChildTimelines
members.description: Array of child timelines denoting if a child is actively a child of this movieclip on any given frame. Each element in the...

members.name: _totalFrames
members.brief: The total duration in frames for the animation.

members.name: parentStartPosition
members.brief: Internal property used to control child MovieClips relative to parents.

members.name: addAction
members.description: Handle frame actions, callback is bound to the instance of the MovieClip.

params.description: The clip call on a certain frame

members.name: addKeyframe
members.description: Add a tween to the clip

members.name: addTimedChild
members.description: Add a child to show for a certain number of frames before automatic removal.

params.description: The number of frames to display the child before removing it.
The collection of static keyframes to add

members.name: addTween
members.description: Add a tween to the clip

params.description: Number of frames to tween. If 0, then the properties are set with no tweening.
An optional easing function that takes the tween time from 0-1.

members.name: advance
members.description: Advances the playhead. This occurs automatically each tick by default.

params.description: The amount of time in seconds to advance by. Only applicable if framerate is set.
The duration, if no duration is provided, auto determines length
The framerate to use for independent mode
The frame labels map of label to frames

members.name: gotoAndPlay
members.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to false.

params.description: The animation name or frame number to go to.

members.name: gotoAndStop
members.description: Advances this movie clip to the specified position or label and sets paused to true.

params.description: The animation or frame name to go to.

members.description: Handle sounds.

params.description: Options parameter. A boolean will act as if all options have been set to that value

members.description: Load a stage scene and add it to the stage.

members.name: Timeline
members.brief: The Timeline class represents a series of tweens, tied to keyframes.

members.description: Current properties in the tween, to make building the timeline more efficient.

params.description: The target for this string of tweens.

params.description: The number of frames to hold beyond startFrame (0 is single frame)

members.name: addTween
members.description: Adds one or more tweens (or timelines) to this timeline. The tweens will be paused (to remove them from the normal ticking...

params.description: The tween(s) to add. Accepts multiple arguments.

returns.description: Tween The first tween that was passed in.

members.name: extendLastFrame
members.description: Extend the last frame of the tween.

members.name: getPropFromShorthand
members.description: Get the value for a property

members.name: duration
members.brief: duration of tween in frames. A single-frame keyframe has a duration of 0.

members.name: endFrame
members.brief: the frame that the tween ends on

members.name: endProps
members.description: Properties at the end of the tween, as well as any properties that are set instead of tweened

members.brief: Regex to test for a basic ease desccriptor

members.name: createInstance
members.brief: Enable or disable automatic instantiation of stage - defaults to false.

members.name: duration
members.brief: The duration of the clip. If no duration is provided, length is automatically determined.

members.name: e
members.brief: Eases for any of the tweenable properties, if published as a per-property ease

members.name: framerate
members.brief: The framerate to use for an independent mode MovieClip. Default is 24.

members.name: labels
members.brief: The frame labels map - label to frames

members.name: loop
members.brief: If playback is looped. Default is true.

members.name: metadata
members.brief: Metadata to be handed off to the loader for assets that are loaded.

members.name: mode
members.brief: The default playback mode is independent (0). Child movieclips are given a different value as subordinate objects.

members.name: parent
members.brief: The Container to auto-add the stage to, if createInstance is true.

members.name: tw
members.brief: Not tweenable, but information about a tween that starts on this frame

members.brief: The format of the output javascript file when publishing a scene.

members.name: assets
members.brief: Dictionary of paths to shape files and textures, indexed by unique id within the scene file.

members.brief: Background color of the scene, as defined when the asset is published.

members.brief: Framerate of the scene (frames per second), as defined when the asset is published.

members.description: Function for getting a texture by ID. It can be set to PIXI.Texture.from for global texture atlas.

members.brief: Height of the scene, as defined when the asset is published.

members.description: Dictionary of display object constructors used within this scene. This is an empty object before setup() is run, but can b...

members.description: Creates classes for each Container and MovieClip within the scene, filling data.lib and setting data.stage.

members.name: spritesheets

members.name: stage
members.brief: Constructor for the root MovieClip. Is null before setup() is run.

members.description: Dictionary of loaded individual images for this scene. This is intially an empty object that will be filled by animate.loa...

members.name: totalFrames
members.brief: Total number of frames of the root MovieClip.

members.name: version
members.description: File format version that the asset was published for. 2 is the base version that PixiAnimate 2.0.0 supports.

members.name: width
members.brief: Width of the scene, as defined when the asset is published.
